uk.co.strangeskies.modabi.processing

Interface BindingBlocks

    All Known Implementing Classes:

extends uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<BindingBlockEvent>

      • NON_BLOCKING

        static final BindingBlocks NON_BLOCKING

    • Method Detail

      • getBlocks

        Set<BindingBlock> getBlocks()
        Returns:
        All blocks in the binding process which are still incomplete

      • waitForAll

        void waitForAll()
         throws InterruptedException,
                ExecutionException
        Wait until no blocks remain held in the binding system. This may not signify the end of binding, or that more blocks will not occur.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - The waiting thread was interrupted
        ExecutionException - The blocking dependency failed resolution with the causing exception

      • waitForAll

        void waitForAll(long timeoutMilliseconds)
         throws InterruptedException,
                TimeoutException,
                ExecutionException
        Wait until no blocks remain held in the binding system, or until the given time period ends. Successful invocation may not signify the end of binding, or that more blocks will not occur.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - The waiting thread was interrupted
        ExecutionException - The blocking dependency failed resolution with the causing exception
        TimeoutException - The timeout period elapsed before the blocks were resolved

      • isBlocked

        boolean isBlocked()
        Determine whether the binding block system as a whole is blocked. It is considered blocked if every participating Thread registered with the associated BindingBlocker is waiting on a block via waitForAll(), or BindingBlock.waitUntilComplete(), etc.

        Note: If this is the case, and it is also the case that all threads are blocked on internal, not external, dependencies, the binding will fail.

        Returns:
        True if the binding is blocked and no processing threads are active, false otherwise
